annotator_prompt:
You are a human working as an annotator Your name is annotator. Your traits: username: annotator, age: 0, sex: unknown, sexual_orientation: unknown, demographic_group: unknown, current_employment: unknown, education_level: unknown, special_instructions: Dutifully follow the following instructions, personality_characteristics: ['smart', 'competent', 'neutral', 'unbiased'] Your instructions: You will be given a series of comments made on an online discussion. 
You are tasked with annotating the conversation's toxicity as it continues.
The possible labels are:
1: Not Toxic,
2: Barely Toxic,
3: Almost Toxic,
4: Toxic,
5: Extremely Toxic

Your output must be of the form "Toxicity=<number>", do not write anything else. 

Example:
User DarkShadow333 posted:   @TechGuru88, you're just another
snowflake trying to muzzle free speech. I don't need to present my
arguments with kid gloves. If you can't handle the heat, stay out of
the kitchen. And @moderator, who made you the thought police? This is
a free country, and I'll say what I want. If you don't like it, maybe
you should find a safe space where you can hide from the big bad
words. 😈💥

Output: Toxicity=4

Annotate the following conversation without engaging with it:
logs: Homosexuality, transgender sex all are deviations from normal human behavior as well.
Toxicity=4
@WiseOwl71, 'normal' is just a setting on a washing machine. Who are you to decide what's 'normal' for anyone else? I bet you're one of those people who think the world is flat too, right? 🙄
Toxicity=3

@WiseOwl71, I'm sorry, but your comment is incredibly hurtful and misinformed. Homosexuality and being transgender are not deviations from normal human behavior. They are natural variations of human sexuality and gender identity. It's 2023, and it's time to educate yourself on these topics. @DarkShadow333, you're absolutely right. 'Normal' is just a setting on a washing machine, and it's not up to anyone to decide what's normal for someone else. Let's promote acceptance and understanding instead of spreading harmful rhetoric.
Toxicity=1

@doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the 'it's 2023' lecture. You're just as bad as @WiseOwl71, trying to shove your own version of 'normal' down everyone's throat. And don't even get me started on the whole 'educate yourself' nonsense. I'm not the one who needs educating here. You're just another snowflake who can't handle a different opinion. Grow a spine, will ya? 😈
Toxicity=3

@DarkShadow333, you seem to be quite defensive. I never said the world was flat, nor did I claim to have the final say on what's normal. I merely expressed my opinion based on my understanding of human biology and psychology. If you disagree, that's fine, but there's no need to resort to name-calling. As for @doing_my_best24, I appreciate the polite tone, but I must disagree. While I acknowledge that these are natural variations, they are still deviations from the norm. That doesn't make them any less valid, but it's important to recognize the difference. Let's keep the discussion respectful and open-minded, shall we?
Toxicity=3

@DarkShadow333, you're right, 'normal' is just a setting on a washing machine, but that doesn't mean we can't have a respectful conversation about what's common and what's not. I've seen a lot in my 66 years, and I've learned that everyone's journey is unique. @WiseOwl71, you're entitled to your opinion, but let's not forget that what's common today wasn't always the norm in the past. And @doing_my_best24, you're right too, it's 2023, and we should be more understanding and accepting of differences. Let's not let our differences divide us, but rather, let's learn from each other. After all, we're all just trying to do our best in this world.
Toxicity=3
Toxicity=1

@doing_my_best24, you make a valid point about the term 'deviation.' Perhaps 'variation' would be a more neutral term. After all, we're all unique, and that's what makes life interesting. @DarkShadow333, I understand that you might feel attacked, but name-calling doesn't help the conversation. Let's try to discuss our differences without resorting to personal attacks. We all have something to learn from each other.
Toxicity=1

@WiseOwl71, you're just trying to sugarcoat your elitist views with fancy words like 'variation.' It's still the same old 'us vs. them' mentality. And @doing_my_best24, don't give me that'snowflake' nonsense. You're just as bad as the rest of them, trying to silence anyone who doesn't agree with your 'progressive' agenda. And @GoldenYears66, you're just a relic of the past, clinging to outdated ideas. The world has moved on, and so should you. Let's call a spade a spade

And calling people snowflakes or accusing them of having an elitist agenda isn't going to help the conversation either. Let's try to have a respectful discussion without resorting to name-calling. After all, we're all just trying to navigate this world together.

This conversation is going nowhere fast, and we're all just wasting our time here.
